page.title: 13BUILDINGS IN CLAYPOLE
page.content: There is a large and beautiful church at Claypole dedicated to St. Peter. Money is presently being raised to restore various parts of it. Heating has recently been installed, a welcome innovation as the church is used for weekly services. There is a churchyard, which is still in use, adjacent to the church. The rector, Reverend David Ensor, lives in the village and serves four parishes altogether. Further down the main street is the Methodist Chapel and the village hall run by a resident caretaker. There is a post office, which also serves neighbouring villages, two butcher's shops, a general store and a greengrocer's. Along the main street are two public houses both fully licensed.
